<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 435, 880, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 664, 215, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 73, 608, 92]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by \(\operatorname {f}(x) = -2x^{2} - 8x - 13\) for \(x< -3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 106, 697, 123]]<|/det|>
Express \(\operatorname {f}(x)\) in the form \(-2(x + a)^2 + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 351, 185, 369]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 351, 313, 368]]<|/det|>
Find the range of f.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 350, 920, 368]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 527, 141, 545]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 527, 400, 545]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\operatorname {f}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 527, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
A large industrial water tank is such that, when the depth of the water in the tank is \(x\) metres, the volume \(V\mathrm{m}^3\) of water in the tank is given by \(V = 243 - \frac{1}{3} (9 - x)^3\). Water is being pumped into the tank at a constant rate of \(3.6\mathrm{m}^3\) per hour.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 139, 920, 173]]<|/det|>
Find the rate of increase of the depth of the water when the depth is \(4\mathrm{m}\), giving your answer in cm per minute.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 154, 920, 172]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[329, 87, 695, 345]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 357, 920, 420]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a curve which has a maximum point at (8, 12) and a minimum point at (8, 0). The curve is the result of applying a combination of two transformations to a circle. The first transformation applied is a translation of \(\left( \begin{array}{c}7 \\ -3 \end{array} \right)\). The second transformation applied is a stretch in the \(y\)-direction.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 432, 146, 450]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 432, 440, 450]]<|/det|>
State the scale factor of the stretch.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 432, 920, 450]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 540, 146, 558]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 540, 455, 558]]<|/det|>
State the radius of the original circle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 540, 920, 558]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 648, 146, 666]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 648, 920, 682]]<|/det|>
State the coordinates of the centre of the circle after the translation has been completed but before the stretch is applied.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 664, 920, 682]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 804, 148, 822]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 804, 601, 822]]<|/det|>
State the coordinates of the centre of the original circle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 804, 920, 822]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 841, 920, 866]]<|/det|>
<form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 356, 92]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\alpha = \cos^{-1}\left(\frac{8}{17}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 913, 144]]<|/det|>
Find, without using the trigonometric functions on your calculator, the exact value of \(\frac{1}{\sin \alpha} + \frac{1}{\tan \alpha}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 136, 920, 154]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 499, 102]]<|/det|>
The curve \(y = \operatorname {f}(x)\) is such that \(\operatorname {f}^{\prime}(x) = \frac{- 3}{(x + 2)^{4}}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 119, 680, 141]]<|/det|>
The tangent at a point on the curve where \(x = a\) has gradient \(- \frac{16}{27}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 152, 395, 171]]<|/det|>
Find the possible values of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 152, 920, 171]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 660, 92]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) given that the curve passes through the point \((-1, 5)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 541, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region in terms of \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 705, 92]]<|/det|>
The first term of a geometric progression is 216 and the fourth term is 64.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 106, 500, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the sum to infinity of the progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
The second term of the geometric progression is equal to the second term of an arithmetic progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
The third term of the geometric progression is equal to the fifth term of the same arithmetic progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 148, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 135, 663, 153]]<|/det|>
Find the sum of the first 21 terms of the arithmetic progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[311, 87, 705, 361]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 380, 918, 416]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the circle \(x^{2} + y^{2} = 2\) and the straight line \(y = 2x - 1\) intersecting at the points \(A\) and \(B\). The point \(D\) on the \(x\)-axis is such that \(AD\) is perpendicular to the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 428, 146, 447]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 428, 366, 447]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 429, 918, 447]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 112]]<|/det|>
Find the volume of revolution when the shaded region is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(x\)-axis. Give your answer in the form \(\frac{\pi}{a} \left(b\sqrt{c} - d\right)\), where \(a, b, c\) and \(d\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 111]]<|/det|>

<mark>[2]
